Class Pokemon

  • java.lang.Object
    • Pokemon

  • public class Pokemon
extends java.lang.Object
    The pokemon class is the first object in the project. It creates, using the database class pokedex, a pokemon based off two factors, the pokemon's dex number and its level. After that it generates unique stats and stores a unique pokemon. A pokemon generated at the end of the constructor will have all it's fields filled, and be ready for a battle. It can be used to generate wild pokemon or trainer pokemon. This class is damn near complete. It still has a few missing fields though, due to them not being used in the battle class as of yet. ToDo: status effect storage, access, mutate leveling up method ev, xp gain

    • Constructor Detail

      • Pokemon

        public Pokemon(int dexNumber,
       int lv)
        Creates a pokemon object. The constructor will create a pokedex object, then use the two parameters to generate a pokemon from the stats obtained from the pokedex. All values will be filled at the end of the constructor.
        Parameters:
        dexNumber - pokedex number of the pokemon to create.
        lv - level of the pokemon to create.

    • Method Detail

      • genIVs

        private int[] genIVs()
        Generates Indiviual values for the pokemon randomly. This method creates the unique IV values for the pokemon. It is only called in construction.
        Returns:
        The indiviual values in an int[]

      • genStats

        private int[] genStats()
        Generate the stat values using IVs, EVs, and base stats. This method calculates the pokemons stats, which happens on construction as well as when the pokemon levels. calculations are done as doubles in the method. note: while this class could be in the Cal class, it's here due to the number of variables required to move as well as the cal class wasn't written till this was already implemented.
        Returns:
        int[] of the generated stats of the pokemon

      • levelup

        private void levelup()
        Calls the required methods and does the math to increase the pokemon's level. FLAG:: UNIMPLEMENTED

      • populateMoveList

        private void populateMoveList()
        Populates the pokemon's current moves with the highest moves available to it. It uses the moveList hashmap from the pokedex class to build an array of moves currently learned, for accessablity. FLAG:: This can technically leave a pokemon with no attack moves. This needs to be fixed, or proven possible in the original.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Accessor for the name of the pokemon. If the pokemon has a nickname, that is returned instead.
        Returns:
        String name, or nickname, of the pokemon.

      • movesTS

        public java.lang.String movesTS()
        Accessor for a toString representation of the move list. FLAG:: This is currently unused. It got reworked for UI purposes. That section can either be rewritten (if neccessary) or this can be removed. It's still here because it may be useful in the game functions.
        Returns:
        String representation of the moves[]

      • getMoves

        public Move[] getMoves()
        Accessor for the move[] of the pokemon.
        Returns:
        The pokemon's move[]

      • getStat

        public int getStat(java.lang.String i)
        Multi Accessor for the stats of a pokemon. note: This is an experiment, condensing the number of accessors in the class by providing a search parameter. It works, as of 0.1.
        Parameters:
        i - stat to be returned.
        Returns:
        The integer stat value.

      • getLevel

        public int getLevel()
        Accessor for the level of the pokemon.
        Returns:
        Int of the pokemons level

      • getCurrentHP

        public int getCurrentHP()
        Accessor for the pokemon's current HP.
        Returns:
        integer of the pokemon's current health.

      • getPP

        public int getPP(int move)
        Accessor for the PP of a pokemon's move. This is a chain method, only used when a method can't access the move itself.
        Parameters:
        move - The int index of the move in the moves[]
        Returns:
        the int PP of the specifed move.

      • setHP

        public void setHP(int ne)
        Mutator to change a pokemon's currentHP value.
        Parameters:
        ne - New HP int value.

      • minusPP

        public void minusPP(int y)
        Mutator to subtract one from the PP of a move. This is a chain method, only used when a method can't access the move itself.
        Parameters:
        y - The int index of the move in moves[]

      • nickname

        public void nickname(java.lang.String nickname)
        Mutator to set a pokemon's nickname. This method isn't called in the constructor, or anywhere in battle. It's useless now, but is here anyway. It will be used on capture, if that's ever implemented.
        Parameters:
        nickname - The String nickname the user gives.

      • setStat

        public void setStat(java.lang.String i,
           int v)
        Mutator to change a pokemon's stat manually. This method is used for stat damage moves. It shouldn't be called for leveling up.
        Parameters:
        i - String name of the stat to modify.
        v - The int amount to modify the stat to.
